label: Temperature (C)
method: in-situ digital probe measurement

label: Gravitational moisture (%)
method: mass difference between field moist and oven-dry soil after 24 hours at 105 degrees celsius divided by oven-dry soil mass without coarse material (>= 2 mm)

label: Volumetric moisture (g/cm3)
method: mass difference between field moist and oven-dry soil after 24 hours at 105 degrees celsius divided by oven-dry soil mass without coarse material (>= 2 mm)

label: Bulk density (g/cm3)
method: mass of oven-dry soil after 24 hours at 105 degrees celsius minus coarse material  (>= 2 mm) mass divided by core volume minus coarse material  (>= 2 mm) volume

label: Coarse material (g)
description: mass of coarse material greater than or equal to 2 mm
method: mass of coarse material (>= 2 mm) removed from oven-dry soil, includes rocks, roots, and other hard fragments like bark or shells

label: TN (%)
method: elemental analysis

label: TC (%)
method: elemental analysis; used maxium of C concentration of bulk soil and acid-fumigated soil to ensure non-negative TIC concentration and that TOC concentrations did not exceed TC concentrations

label: C:N Ratio
method: divided TC concentration by TN concentration

label: TOC (%)
unit: mass percent (%; g organic carbon/g soil)
method: elemental analysis after 8 hour acid-fumigation with hydrochloric(HCl) acid (100 cm3 of 10 molar solution)

label: Sand (%)
method: hydrometer method

label: Silt (%)
method: hydrometer method

label: Clay (%)
method: hydrometer method

label: Texture class
unit: one of twelve descriptive categories based on sand, silt, and clay percent
method: US Department of Agriculture soil texture classification

label: pH
method: 1:1 water to soil solution

label: P (ppm)
unit: parts per million (1 kg P/1000 m3 of soil solution)
method: mehlich 3 extraction followed by concentration measurement with inductively coupled plasma spectrometer

label: K (ppm)
unit: parts per million (1 kg K/1000 m3 of soil solution)
method: mehlich 3 extraction followed by concentration measurement with inductively coupled plasma spectrometer

label: Ca (ppm)
unit: parts per million (1 kg Ca/1000 m3 of soil solution)
method: mehlich 3 extraction followed by concentration measurement with inductively coupled plasma spectrometer

label: Mg (ppm)
unit: parts per million (1 kg Mg/1000 m3 of soil solution)
method: mehlich 3 extraction followed by concentration measurement with inductively coupled plasma spectrometer

label: SOM (%)
unit: mass percent (%; g organic matter/g soil)
method: loss on ignition at 405 degrees celsis for 2.5 hours

label: NO3-N (ppm)
unit: parts per million (1 kg NO3-N/1000 m3 of soil solution)
method: extraction with 2 molar potassium chlorid (KCl) solution followed by concentration measruement with a flow injection analyzer

label: NH4-N (ppm)
unit: parts per million (1 kg NH4-N/1000 m3 of soil solution)
method: extraction with 2 molar potassium chlorid (KCl) solution followed by concentration measruement with a flow injection analyzer

label: CEC (meq/100 g)
method: calculated as sum of K, Ca, Mg, and H (meq/100 g)

label: K (meq/100 g)
description: contribution of potassium (K+) to base saturation
method: meq K / 100 g = ppm  K / 390

label: Ca (meq/100 g)
description: contribution of calcium (Ca2+) to base saturation
method: meq Ca / 100 g = ppm Ca / 200

label: Mg (meq/100 g)
description: contribution of magnesium (Mg2+) to base saturation
method: meq Mg / 100 g = ppm Mg / 120

label: H (meq/100 g)
description: contribution of hydrogen (H+) to base saturation
method: meq H / 100 g = ppm H / 10.8

label: POC (%)
description: concentration of coarse particulate organic carbon (>= 53 microns)
unit: mass percent (%; g particulate organic carbon [>=53 microns]/g soil)
method: size fractionation procedure in Ugarte et al. (2018) where 10 g samples were shaken in 10% sodium hexametaphosphate solution for 1 hour at 180 oscillations per minute, followed by ten 10-minute shakes with distilled water, transferring to new 53-micron mesh, oven-drying at 50 degrees C for 24 hours, and elemental analysis; raw C concentrations were multiplied by the particulate organic matter (>= 53 micron) mass out of the 10 g soil sample

label: EV (m)
description: average ground elevation with 1-m x 1-m quadrat
method: estimated using zonal statistics based on LiDAR-derived digital elevation model

label: HT (m)
description: average vegetation height with 1-m x 1-m quadrat
method: estimated using zonal statistics based on LiDAR-derived vegetation height raster

label: Floating POM
description: mass of floating particulate organic matter
unit: mass percent (%; g floating particulate organic matter/g soil)
method: skimmed from water surface and oven-dried at 60 degrees celsius for 48 hours after wet sieving with 5 minutes of submersion in distilled water followed by automated sieving for 2 minutes (30 repititions/minutes)

label: >= 4.75 mm
description: mass of aggregates with diameters greater than or equal to 4.75 mm
unit: mass percent (%; g aggregates [>=4.75 mm]/g soil)
method: wet sieving with 5 minutes of submersion in distilled water followed by automated sieving for 2 minutes (30 repititions/minutes) and oven drying at 60 degrees celsius for 48 hours and removal of corase material (>= 2 mm)

label: 2-4.75 mm
description: mass of aggregates with diameters less than 4.75 mm and greater than or equal to 2 mm
unit: mass percent (%; g aggregates [>= 2 mm, <4.75 mm]/g soil)
method: wet sieving with 5 minutes of submersion in distilled water followed by automated sieving for 2 minutes (30 repititions/minutes) and oven drying at 60 degrees celsius for 48 hours and removal of corase material (>= 2 mm)

label: 0.250-2 mm
description: mass of aggregates with diameters less than 2 mm and greater than or equal to 0.250 mm
unit: mass percent (%; g aggregates [>= 0.250 mm, <2 mm]/g soil)
method: wet sieving with 5 minutes of submersion in distilled water followed by automated sieving for 2 minutes (30 repititions/minutes) and oven drying at 60 degrees celsius for 48 hours

label: 0.053-0.250 mm
description: mass of aggregates with diameters less than 0.250 mm and greater than or equal to 0.053 mm
unit: mass percent (%; g aggregates [>= 0.053 mm, <250 mm]/g soil)
method: wet sieving with 5 minutes of submersion in distilled water followed by automated sieving for 2 minutes (30 repititions/minutes) and oven drying at 60 degrees celsius for 48 hours

label: <0.053 mm
description: mass of mineral-associated organic matter or microaggregates with size less than or equal to 0.053 mm
unit: mass percent (%; g aggregates [< 0.053 mm]/g soil)
method: calculated as difference between total soil mass minus coarse material (>= 2 mm) and mass of all other aggregate size classes, including fPOM

label: Mean-weight diameter (mm)
description: mean-weight diamater across all aggregate size classes with diameters greater than or equal to 0.053 mm
method: calculated by summing together the mean diameter of each size class above 0.053 mm and mutliplying by the mass percent of the respective size class

label: TIC (%)
unit: mass percent (%; g total inorganic carbon/g soil)
method: difference between TC and TOC concentration

label: MOC (%)
unit: mass percent (%; g mineral-associated organic carbon [<53 microns]/g soil)
method: calculated as the difference between the TOC and POC concentration

label: POC:MOC ratio
description: ratio of particulate organic matter to mineral-associated organic matter concentration
unit: unitless (g particulate organic carbon/g mineral-associated organic carbon)
method: divided POC concentration by MOC concentration
